page.title: 01General description,Ryhill
page.content: Ryhill and Havercroft are two mining villages-population 4000 -which grew up around collieries now closed.There are also the hamlets of Cold Hiendley and Wintersett.Mining is still the dominant economic activity. Extensive reclamation work will result in re-instatement of agricultural land and creation of a new country park including a sizeable lake.Two existing reservoirs provide sailing and fishing facilities for the public.A further lake,part of a private club,is used periodically for public water sports activities in addition to members' use.The Barnsley Canal,now disused, runs through an attractive part of the area.Long stretches retain water and a local restoration group has been formed.There are extensive Forestry Commission woodlands and some good agricultural land.
